unnormalised: Hey folks, concerning pesticide usage, isn't it getting a bit excessive? Remember the Kerala floods? Some studies linked it to pesticide runoff. My grandfather in his village, Kozhikode, always used organic methods. During Onam, we'd have such fresh veggies! Maybe Krishi Vigyan Kendra can promote better alternatives, like neem oil. Rs. 5000 worth pesticides per acre seems crazy.
